title: VehicleDescriptionFormat
description: The Vehicle Description Format is a generalized description format for multi-segment vehicles developed by Fraunhofer IVI.

version.description: The version of the vehicle description format (MAJOR.MINOR)

vehicleDescription.description: Represents a full vehicle combination as an array of vehicle segments. The first item describes the towing vehicle. The remaining items describe subsequently attached trailers.

Axle.title: Axle
Axle.description: Represents an axle of a vehicle segment.

name.description: The name of the axle, e.g. 'front_axle'.

pose.description: The pose of the axle on the vehicle segment.

wheels.description: Represents the wheels mounted to the axle.

steering.description: The steering properties of the axle.

type.description:
The steering type of this axle:

* fixed: The axle is not steerable.
* forced: The axle is steerable and the steering angle is actively set by a driver or automatic system.
* friction: The axle is steerable and the steering angle adjusts passively due to ground friction.

reference.description:
The reference must be set if the steering type is 'forced'. The reference determines how the steering angle is set:

* remote: The steering angle is set by the driver or automatic system.
* steering_axle: The steering angle is determined by a steering function based on the steering angle of another axle (see 'reference_axle_id').
* articulation_angle: The steering angle is determined by a steering function based on the articulation angle of the vehicle segment which this axle belongs to.

referenceAxleID.description: The ID of the axle, whose steering angle is used as input for the steering function to calculate this axle's steering angle.

Geometry.title: Geometry
Geometry.description:
Represents the 3D geometry of a vehicle segment or a part of the vehicle segment, e.g. the bounding box of the chassis. 

Possible types:

* Box: The box geometry represents a cuboid with a fixed length, width and height. The anchor point of the box is its geometric center, also known as centroid. 
* Mesh: The mesh geometry represents a 3D mesh specified by the file path to the 3D mesh file.

pose.description: The pose of the anchor point of the geometry on the vehicle segment.

collision.description: Whether the geometry is relevant for collision detection.

Joint.description: Represents a hinge joint where two vehicle segments can be linked together.
Joint.title: Joint

pose.description: The pose of the joint on the vehicle segment.

maxAngle.description: The maximum allowable angle to which the joint can extend.

format.description: The format of the mesh file.

meshFile.description: The file path to the 3D mesh file.

orientation.description: Represents the rotation around fixed axis: first roll around x, then pitch around y and finally yaw around z.

r.description: The roll angle around the x-axis (degrees).

p.description: The pitch angle around the y-axis (degrees).

y.description: The yaw angle around the z-axis (degrees).

VehicleSegment.title: VehicleSegment
VehicleSegment.description:
Represents a vehicle segment, which can be either a towing machine or a trailer. 

All poses used for describing the vehicle segment and its components refer to a fixed cartesian coordinate system which can be arbitrarily chosen but is subject to following constraints:
  * x - forwards
  * y - left
  * z - up
  
For all nested components, the pose of the nested component is defined relative to the pose of the parent component. E.g. the pose of a wheel is defined relative to the pose of the axle, that the wheel is mounted on.

All units are given in meters or degrees.

id.description: The ID of the vehicle segment.

name.description: The name of the vehicle segment.

geometry.description: An array of geometry primitives or meshes describing the physical dimensions of the vehicle segment.

groundClearance.description: The minimum distance between the lowest point of the chassis and the ground.

referencePose.description: The reference pose of the root coordinate system of the vehicle segment. The root coordinate system refers to the primary reference frame used to define the pose of the vehicle segment in 3D space.

axles.description: Represents the axles of the vehicle segment.

frontJoint.description: Represents the front joint of the vehicle segment.

rearJoint.description: Represents the rear joint of the vehicle segment.

name.description: The name or identifier of the wheel, e.g. 'left_wheel'.

pose.description: The pose of the wheel's center with regard to the pose of the axle which the wheel is mounted on.

tire.description: The tire is the rubber component that fits around the wheel.
